title: Easter Dinner - Roast Leg of Lamb
description: Sam the Cooking Guy's roasted leg of lamb recipe with mint sauce makes a savory dinner for your family Easter meal.

asset.author: Bed Bath & Beyond
asset.hookText: Sam the Cooking Guy's roasted leg of lamb recipe with mint sauce makes a savory dinner for your family Easter meal

transcripts:
When it comes to an Easter meal, tell me what's better than lamb. Go ahead. Exactly. Because nothing's better than lamb, and when it's this good-- 

[MUSIC PLAYING] 

Put salt and five peeled cloves of garlic in a mortar and pestle. You could use a processor, but for a small amount I think a mortar and pestle is perfect. "Pessle", "pestle". Which is it? "Pessle" or "pestle"? I gotta check, and it is "pessle". No "T". Well, the "T" is there, you don't say it. 

Then add two tablespoons each of fresh rosemary and parsley, and mash until well blended. Then stir in Dijon mustard, lemon juice, and olive oil. Mix well. Place a boneless tied leg of lamb on a roasting rack, rub well with the rosemary/garlic mixture, and put into a 400 degree oven. Roast approximately an hour and a half or until an instant read thermometer shows about 140 degrees for medium rare. 

And while it cooks we'll make a little sauce for it. Combined plain nonfat yogurt, minced garlic, finely chopped mint, kosher salt, and juice of half a lime, and mix well. And when the lamb is ready, just remove, cover with foil, and let rest 20 minutes before slicing and plating. Lamb for Easter. I'm not saying you have to make it, but you have to make it. 

[MUSIC PLAYING]
